intro: Jurinea moschus, commonly known as the muskflower, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the cold climates of the Arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Jurinea moschus is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in areas with low nutrient availability.
